question: The company is going to implement a(n) ________ expansion plan to double its market, but we doubt if it's feasible.
Sam did not get fired; instead, he left his job ________ because he had some personal issues to deal with.
Women have long been regarded as hard-wired to have an innate sixth sense, which is known as women's ________.
The word 'nomophobia' was first ________ in 2005 to refer to the fear of being without a mobile phone.
The archer has always had his heart set on the ________ dream to gain an Olympic medal even after years of training and hard work.

Our English teacher gave us some more example sentences to ________ our memory of the usage of this word, which was taught in the previous lesson.
The famous soccer player has a(n) ________ tattoo of an eagle covering his right shoulder and arm, which looks like a real one.
Though times are bad, there are still ________ opportunities for well-qualified and well-prepared job seekers.
Not until Mary's parents accidentally found that her classmates had insulted and criticized her did they learn that she had been ________ abused at school.
Studies show that early ________ to piano practice can help build up children's language skills. This will probably prompt more parents to force their kids to take piano lessons.
Thanks to advances in assisted reproduction, the death of the last male northern white rhino doesn't necessarily mean ________ for the species.
The suicide bombing was an act of ________ triggered by the collective injustice that the bomber's community suffers.
When the judge saw the fans of the accused superstar screaming in the courtroom, he immediately ________ the police to arrest them.
Cashless businesses were once a(n) ________ case in some specific shopping venues, but now, cashless is fast on its way to becoming the norm.
When the chilly wind started to blow in the evening, many pedestrians on the street ________ their hands into the pockets.
After the earthquake, hundreds of victims took ________ in the playground of a local high school for fear that the disaster might strike again.
This pair of sneakers is expensive but ________. With proper use and care, it is supposed to last more than ten years.
I'd advise you to avoid any ________ with Jim, as he is known for a long record of dishonest deeds.
It's not a formal party, so you come in ________ wear, such as T-shirts, shorts, hoodies or jeans.
Longing for more ________ to ancient civilization, Joseph decides to make a trip to Egypt.
The difference between the two pictures is too small to be ________; they look practically the same.
According to the existing election law, Joe is not ________ to run for chairman because he is a foreigner, and not a permanent resident.
Strict laws and punishments may help reduce the crime rate but cannot totally ________ crime.
Job interviews provide a great opportunity for the employer to ________ the capability and suitability of the candidates.
Louise ________ recalled how he used to bully the nerdy kids back in high school. He feels guilty all the time.
The president was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his outstanding ________ of solving the nuclear crisis.
After a ten-hour discussion, the board members finally decided to ________ my suggestion on the new product.
I have just heard form the manager that the final project of our team will be ________ next Monday. There is not much time left for us.
Thanks to the latest 5G network, international ________ via the Internet will no longer be disturbed by external factors, such as slow connect speed.
The country has been divided for a long time. The candidate has stated once he wins the election, he is going to ________ the state and end the long-lasting division.
After several months of investigation, the team concluded that the disaster could have been easily avoided if everyone had been on the same page to ________ the accident.
The college authorities cut the student's speech because they did not want people to know about their scandal. However, the ________ action backfired on them very soon.
The infection rate and death toll of the virus have dropped down significantly. However, the government is still not ________ with the current result and keeps promoting social distancing.

Traditional sports start to notice the rise of E-sports and view it as a ________, for E-sports generate millions of dollars of revenue each year and are gradually taking over the market of traditional sports.

Nowadays, we media, also known as self-media, has gradually become a(n) ________ element of the media world. As more and more mainstream media show their political preferences, the general public is looking for more neutral third-party news.
Many trees have been felled for ________ developments; as cities grow larger, the woodlands shrink.
Our homeroom teacher ________ us in the school's music hall for the live concert given by a famous orchestra in Taiwan.
To better his English speaking skills, Jason hired a private ________ to help with his poor pronunciation and fluency.
Though the small and shabby apartment is far from desirable, it's ________ to me since I can't afford a better one now.
As a punishment, the airline decided to ________ those who took part in yesterday's protest. In total, 53 flight attendants and pilots would lose their jobs as a result.
To express their dissatisfaction with the new economic policy, tens of thousands of people ________ in front of the presidential office this morning.
Because Teresa was found to be ________, she decided to adopt one child from the nearby orphanage.
The most important ________ of one's stomach is to break down food to allow efficient absorption when it passes through the intestine.
After having been in a coma for several days, the seriously injured patient finally regained ________. He can talk and eat on his own now.
The hiking trail climbed ________ upwards, leaving the hikers breathless and exhausted.
The dairy company recalled a popular mile product after discovering that it might have been ________ by a cleaning solution during production.
Aloe vera has long been used as a skincare remedy. In addition to moisturizing the skin, the plant has a(n) ________ effect on burns.
As I get ________ very easily, I avoid listening to music while I'm studying or doing my homework.
A political dissident sought refuge in a foreign ________, claiming that his life was under threat due to his anti-government activities.
In the ________ village, time seems to stop. It is the perfect place for people like me who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life.
To communicate effectively, you have to learn to speak with ________ and avoid beating around the bush.
The celebrity hired a famous lawyer to ________ for him.
If you are looking for information about the company, you can check out its ________.
The ________ of the new policy is to reduce air pollution.
The ________ of the earthquake measured 6.5 on the Richter scale.
The ________ of the new product has been delayed due to technical problems.
The ________ of the story is that honesty is the best policy.
The ________ of the sun is essential for all life on earth.
The ________ of the internet has changed the way we communicate.
The ________ of the problem lies in the lack of communication.
The ________ of the mountain was covered in snow.
The ________ of the car is damaged.
The ________ of the situation is very serious.
The ________ of the music is very soothing.
The ________ of the flower is very fragrant.
The government has announced a new ________ to boost the economy.
The company is facing a severe ________ of skilled workers.
The doctor prescribed some ________ to relieve the pain.
The police are investigating the ________ of the crime.
The student made a ________ effort to improve his grades.
The building was destroyed by a massive ________.
The team won the championship for the third ________ year.
The artist's work is characterized by its ________ style.
The politician was accused of ________ corruption.
The scientist conducted a ________ experiment to test the hypothesis.
The company has a strict ________ on sexual harassment.
The student was expelled for ________ the school rules.
The manager is responsible for ________ the staff.
The athlete was disqualified for using ________ drugs.
The government is trying to ________ the economy.
The problem is too ________ to be solved easily.
The solution to the problem is ________.
The company is expanding its ________ operations.
The project was completed ________ of schedule.
The results of the study were ________.
